title: Unknown sub steals SCG spotlight
text:
Substitute fielder Mickey Edwards steals the spotlight at the SCG The Daily Telegraph January 7, 2017 2:41pm 
AS the Aussies were closing in on victory at the SCG on Saturday, it was an unknown substitute fielder who was stealing the show. 
With hit long blonde hair streaming out of his Baggy Green cap, Mickey Edwards was an instant crowd favourite. 
While the commentators initially didn’t know much about him, including his name — they soon discovered that he is a very popular young man. 
Each time the 22-year-old was shown on the big screen or fielded the ball, the SCG crowd went nuts. 
Edwards was also very popular among his new teammates who clearly enjoyed having him on the field. media_camera Mickey Edwards on the field for Australia. Picture: AAP Images. 
Edwards has previously represented New South Wales at under 23 level and has been a member of the Sydney Sixes. 
He has also played second XI county cricket for Middlesex. 
It wasn’t just the SCG crowd that was giving his plenty of love. 
Social media was full of support for the youngster. Meanwhile, what about the reception for sub fielder Mickey Edwards! Get around him! #AUSvPAK pic.twitter.com/zVC9aKZ876
